page.title: 04Post-War Dovercourt
page.content: Forty years ago Dovercourt seafront had a{Band Pavilion}where in the summer a band used to play seven nights of the week. There was an{open {air swimming pool.}It had a spring board and tiered diving boards.There was also a water chute.It didn't have a filter plant like pools have today so it was closed once a fortnight - emptied,hosed down and scrubbed before being filled with fresh seawater. In addition to this there was a large paddling pool with a sandy bottom. The{holiday camp}was built just before the Second World War.For a while it was used for Jewish refugees who escaped from Nazi-occupied Europe. In 1953 there were gale force winds and very high seas which caused serious flooding in Dovercourt and Harwich.We now have sea defences to prevent this happening again.
